text: when the White House scheduled five
television interviews with all the major
networks it was intended to push forward
the economic stimulus bill it didn't
quite work out that way mr. president
has this been an embarrassing day for
the administration well I think it has
it made me angry and disappointed and I
think I messed up I screwed up
withdrawals of both Senator Tom Daschle
and Nancy killifer dominated and are
likely to be more than a one-day
distraction morning everybody as the day
unfolded questions were raised about the
administration's overall approach at the
daily press briefing the thoroughness of
their vetting process for nominees came
up again and again the president's
confident in the people he's chosen to
serve in government again the president
has confidence in the system do you
acknowledge that there is a breakdown in
the vetting process the president is
confident in the process and while the
Obama team was focused on mr. Daschle
and ms killifer Republicans on Capitol
Hill raised more and more questions
about the contents of the stimulus bill
someone needs to explain to me how
giving tens of millions of dollars to
the National Endowment of the Arts or
the Smithsonian museums will reverse the
quote devastating effects of the
economic crisis and it led to tough
questions when President Obama sat down
with the anchors is it getting pecked to
death you are taking hits right now from
some also so what happened the
administration limited each interviews
only ten minutes which didn't allow much
time for follow-up questions and so
President Obama was able to stay on
message in defending his bill and this
hasn't been talked about enough of all
the things that some opponents of the
package have talked about when you tally
all those up amount to less than one
percent less than one percent less than
one percent of the overall package still
it was one of the toughest days so far
for the president at a time when he can
ill afford distractions this is the
problem when you make these
self-inflicted wounds you end up
distracted from really the people's
business
